com.googlecode.kevinarpe.papaya.swing.theme

Class PThemeIconLoaderAbstract

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.googlecode.kevinarpe.papaya.swing.theme.PThemeIconLoaderAbstract
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    PThemeIconLoaderAbstractFixedDimension

    @FullyTested
public abstract class PThemeIconLoaderAbstract
extends Object
    Abstract base class to load theme icons. Implementations can load from different sources, such as file path (on disk) or classpath resource path (embedded in JAR). Normally, an application will employ a few different icon sizes, depending on the widget context.
    Author:
    Kevin Connor ARPE (kevinarpe@gmail.com)
    See Also:
    PThemeIconLoaderAbstractFixedDimension, PThemeIconLoaderFixedDimensionFromPngFile, tryGetIcon(PThemeIconName), getIcon(PThemeIconName), iconExists(PThemeIconName)

      • tryGetIcon

        public PThemeImageIcon tryGetIcon(PThemeIconName name)
        Retrieves an icon based on its name. If the icon is not found, null is returned with is allowed by most Swing widget setIcon(Icon) methods. If the icon is found and returned, it is not guaranteed to be loaded, as loading is an asynchronous operation. Only when the Icon is painted does the thread block to wait for loading to complete. This method is cached, so subsequent calls will return the same reference.

        To guarantee the result is non-null, call getIcon(PThemeIconName).

        Parameters:
        name - id of icon to retrieve. Must not be null
        Returns:
        null if icon not found, else PThemeImageIcon reference
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if name is null
        See Also:
        getIcon(PThemeIconName), iconExists(PThemeIconName), getUrl(PThemeIconName), createThemeImageIcon(PThemeIconName)

      • getIcon

        public PThemeImageIcon getIcon(PThemeIconName name)
        Similar to tryGetIcon(PThemeIconName), but throws IllegalArgumentException if icon not found. This method is cached, so subsequent calls will return the same reference.

        If null result is acceptable, call tryGetIcon(PThemeIconName).

        Parameters:
        name - id of icon to retrieve. Must not be null
        Returns:
        PThemeImageIcon reference, guaranteed non-null
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if name is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if icon for name is not found
        See Also:
        tryGetIcon(PThemeIconName), iconExists(PThemeIconName), getUrl(PThemeIconName), createThemeImageIcon(PThemeIconName)

      • iconExists

        public boolean iconExists(PThemeIconName name)
        Tests if an icon exists, but does not guarantee it can be successfully loaded.
        Parameters:
        name - id of icon to retrieve. Must not be null
        Returns:
        true if icon exists
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if name is null
        See Also:
        tryGetIcon(PThemeIconName), getIcon(PThemeIconName), getUrl(PThemeIconName)

      • getUrl

        protected abstract URL getUrl(PThemeIconName name)
        Creates a URL for a theme icon. Implementing classes may create URLs for file paths or classpath resources. The result is passed Toolkit.getImage(URL).

        Reference: Ref: http://standards.freedesktop.org/icon-theme-spec/icon-theme-spec-latest.html

        Parameters:
        name - id of icon to retrieve. Must not be null
        Returns:
        URL for a theme icon, or null if not exists
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if name is null
        See Also:
        Toolkit.getImage(URL), tryGetIcon(PThemeIconName), getIcon(PThemeIconName), iconExists(PThemeIconName)

      • createThemeImageIcon

        protected abstract PThemeImageIcon createThemeImageIcon(PThemeIconName name)
        Creates a new instance of PThemeImageIcon from a name. Implementations will probably use getUrl(PThemeIconName).
        Parameters:
        name - id of icon to retrieve. Must not be null
        Returns:
        new instance of PThemeImageIcon, or null if not exists
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if name is null
